text: Respecting the will, he wrote to Byron's widow a few days after hearing its contents, 'the very thought of it is painful to me. What Mary has said about it is too true. What Mary the new Lady Byron, had said about it was written on the first half sheet of the same paper: My dearest Annabella,The more we consider the most prominent subject in your letter, the more we are convinced of the truth of that dreadful history connected with it.
